Use this info for testinghttp://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Collections#Collections_Rules_to_Ship | Expected: Stored proc used to create job rowsdbo.CLSP_RULE_CL009Bug 234086: Collections Jobs ignoring Activity Parameters || Step 2: To Do that has been open for X days for payor/collector combo | Expected: Alert created and then re-occurs every 7 days until the to do is closed (the parameter checks for the days being an exact multiple of the parameter i.e. exactly 7, 14, 21 etc. days if X = 7) || Step 3: Using Expert Admin, create a copy of rule (job) to test || Step 4: Start schedule manager, add a new sheduled job | Expected: DaysSitting - Number of days to do has been openNoActivityAlertType - Alert type for created alertsNoActivityAlertNote - Note to attach to created alerts || Step 5: Run job | Expected: Job should complete successfully, rows added to CLM_JOBS

It pre-populates payor if you have a To Do selectedActivity saved to CLM_Activity and shows in the payors workspace activity history tab. || Step 8: Test TwoUsing right click menu and ribbon button Reassign an activity to another collector | Expected: Reassign dialog opensTo do is reassigned to the Reassign To employee chosen in CLM_Activity and is removed from this users To Do grid after refresh. || Step 9: Enter the collector from previous step into the 'Collector' field atop the grid(Security Rights "Collector Search" required) | Expected: Activities for entered collector should be displayed including the todo you reassigned || Step 10: Test ThreeUsing right click menu and ribbon button initiate Push to new date feature | Expected: Opens up "Push to New Date" screenTo Do Date changed to new date || Step 11: Change the date in the top left datepicker | Expected: To Do that was pushed shows in the grid || Step 12: Test FourDouble click on an activity row | Expected: Workspace cards for selected client / payor should open in a new window || Step 13: Select multiple activities and attempt to open workspace card using ribbon button | Expected: Option shoud be inactiveNote: Found that if you hold shift and multi-select; double clicking while still having shift held down will open all the payor workspaces. || Step 14: Test FiveExport the contents of the collector view grid to excel using right click menu and ribbon button | Expected: Excel spreadsheet changed or updated to have the grids contents- Can overwrite an existing fileBug 242796: BUG - Expert Collections Export option || Step 15: Test SixSelect a different display currency using the ribbon button | Expected: Dollar values and symbol for display amount columns should change to selected currency || Step 16: Test SevenFilter the grid using the search/ find box at the top right | Expected: Rows should filter. Matching data should be highlighted || Step 17: Remove search / find criteria | Expected: All rows should return to grid || Step 18: Use advance search to filter grid by payor- May need to use the carrot top (^) symbol at top right to expand the area- Advanced filters can be added using the cog at top left of grid || Step 19: Collapse advance search area | Expected: All rows should return to grid || Step 20: Test EightDouble click or use right click menu to open workspace card from an alert in alerts tab | Expected: Workspace should open || Step 21: Using right click menu dismiss an alert | Expected: Alert should be removed from tab || Step 22: Change the date on date picker to future date | Expected: Only activities for selected date should show || Step 23: Change the date to a date before today | Expected: Activities for selected date and earlier should show || Step 24: Return to todays date || Step 25: Switch to Recent Tab | Expected: Recent transactions should be displayed for selected activity's client/ payor || Step 26: Switch to the Stats tab | Expected: Data should be displayed for selected activity's client / payor || Step 27: Test NinePrint a collection letter | Expected: Collection letter generated and printed. Note: New Outlook does not work for Email and Email preview || Step 28: Test TenPrint a reminder statement | Expected: Reminder statement generated and printed. Note: New Outlook does not work for Email and Email preview

Title: Exploratory Test
Description: Use this test to conduct exploratory testing on any application or application function. Test cases can be created from bug.

Title: Test Bill View
Steps: Step 1: Ensure there is time entries or disbursements for a payor to use to create a bill using the below shared step if you do not have one to use already. || Step 2: Setup:Installation of the Outloook Addin (search MSI in expertshare and install either the per user or per machine version. Restart outlook and restart Collections.) || Step 3: Use advance search to fill the bill view grid.May need to expand the advanced search area using the ^ at the top right of the gridMay need to add filters using the cog at the top left of the grid.- Payor: Arden Industries | Expected: Might be good to have a bill setup for this smoke test so that the testing can be picked up by anyone || Step 4: Check links in bill view grid a. Bill Number b. Payor c. Bill Type- Can search Bill Type in advanced search- Consolidated- Split | Expected: (include infomation on how to locate the available bill, else how to setup one)a. Bill number link should open bill if available, otherwise Bill files could not be found (happens when documents are not in DD folders, usually from database on a diff machine)Hierarchy follows for the PDF document:1. Checks DDS_Draft table record created when preparing the bill in Billing app2. If it does not find record under DDS_Draft table, it will go to DDM_Path table to look for docudraft path under PDF_PATH (PDF file path) & then under WORK_PATH (Output file path)Bug 264985: Expert Collections 'the file for bill number XXXX could not be found.'b. Payor link should open workspace card. c. Bill type (split & consolidated) should open bill inquiry. || Step 5: Use right click menu to group grid by payor || Step 6: Use right click menu to add 2 display currency columns to grid | Expected: Columns display in the correct display currency and symbol || Step 7: Select a bill. Change bill status using right click and ribbon bar | Expected: Change Bill Status dialog opensBill Status changes in grid and BLT_BillP || Step 8: Select a bill. View bill using right click and ribbon bar | Expected: If the bill file could not be found, "Bill files could not be found" error messageOtherwise the bill file opens in default PDF viewerHierarchy follows for the PDF document:1. Checks DDS_Draft table record created when preparing the bill in Billing app2. If it does not find record under DDS_Draft table, it will go to DDM_Path table to look for docudraft path under PDF_PATH (PDF file path) & then under WORK_PATH (Output file path)Bug 264985: Expert Collections 'the file for bill number XXXX could not be found' || Step 9: Cannot be automated due to need outlook addinExplore the different email options- Email will be disabled if outlook addin not installed and no connection established | Expected: Each email option should function as expected: - Attach bills attaches each selected bill to the emailBUG 281578: Expert Collections - Unable to send/attach bills when using Bill View Method Expert Image on Sierra with Federated ID - Bill list attaches all bills in advanced search grid to email - Simple email attaches no bills || Step 10: Export bills list using right click and ribbon button || Step 11: Use the currency ribbon button to change display currency | Expected: Display currency column amounts should change to selected currency and symbol || Step 12: Using advanced search Bill A/R status, check that search can return bills for each status not just outstanding | Expected: User should have access to all bills, not just outstanding bills Bug 178596: Bill View>Advanced Search. If you search for Prebill for 'Bill A/R Status' nothing shows up. However, if you search Prebill along with "Settled", they show up. Note: Bug 178596 is removed

Values and dates should display correctly based on setting || Step 8: Verify you cannot launch two instances of a form simultaneously || Step 9: Verify launch of correct help files using '(i)' in upper right hand corner || Step 10: Verify tool tips are present on all icons || Step 11: Have more items in the Collectors To Do List then can be displayed at once (can resize the main window to do this) | Expected: Scroll bar should appear as needed || Step 12: Check that selected items highlight / change to selected state || Step 13: Check that selected items return to normal state when deselected || Step 14: Check that keyboard navigation is available within view || Step 15: Check that any tabs function as expected and active tab is well defined || Step 16: Check that all activities showing in view have CLM_ACTIVITY.DONE = N AND CATEGORY = T || Step 17: Check that all activities in view with CLM_ACTIVITY.CATEGORY = A show in alert tab not grid || Step 18: Check that any payor with an alert has alert text in To Do column || Step 19: Check that any activity with CLM_ACTIVITY.IS_ACTIVITY_AUTO = Y has automated icon || Step 20: Check that all items in view have activity date <= date picker date | Expected: - If date in the date picker is in the past or today then it will be <=date. If date in the future then it will be =date- Date picker will not show if advanced search is not collapsed || Step 21: Check that items are grouped by date as default || Step 22: Check that collector field defaults to active user (top right of the grid) | Expected: - If you do not have security to view other collectors list, this is read only || Step 23: Click collector box | Expected: Search box should be displayed W/ list of recently used selections if any. - Verify scroll bar functions || Step 24: Enter data to begin search | Expected: Search should return collectors containing entered values || Step 25: Select desired collector | Expected: Selected data should be entered into box. Title: Test How Columns Appear In Collector View
Steps: Step 1: Use the following link to perform test: http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Collections#Grid_Detail | Expected: Bug 174741: Total LTD Billed Amount needs to reflect Display Currency Symbol in UI- fixedBug  263925 : Vertical lines missing from column headings when global zoom at 80% - fixed || Step 2: Check that all columns appear as directed by Wiki || Step 3: Check that amount columns have total values at bottom || Step 4: Check that totals follow column if column moved. | Expected: Way - None of the columns in Collector > To Do list shows any total. Title: Test How Columns Appear In Bill View
Steps:
Step 2: Use the following link to perform test: http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Collections#Grid_Detail_2 || Step 3: Check that columns display as described in Wiki | Expected: 8220&8300- Total A/R Excluding Interim WO renamed to Collectable A/R-Write-off Amount, Interim Write-off Amount, Payment Amount, Credit Note Amount are displayed as positive values. || Step 4: User Story 266967: As a Collector I want to know the Ebilling status and detail so that can follow up on outstanding Matter & Payor Bills - New columns added to grid and filter in Bills View tab & Payor WS > Bills tab - Current Status, Current Status Date, Current Status Note, Last Submitted Note, Last Accepted Note, Last Reduced Note | Expected: New columns added to Bill View (BillPayorMatterView) should be available in the grid and filter. Note: These columns (fields) will be updated when Change Bill Status action performed from Expert Billing app. If Change Bill Status action is performed from Expert Collection app, it will only update Bill Status field.SQL to run:select bla.TRACK_DATE,bla.NOTE,bla.BILL_STATUS_CODE,bltp.PAYR_CLIENT_UNO,bltp.BILL_TRAN_UNO,* from BLM_BILLP_TRACK blm 
inner join BLA_TRACK bla on blm.CURRENT_TRACK_UNO = bla.TRACK_UNO 
inner join blt_billp bltp on bla.BILLP_UNO = bltp.BILLP_UNO
order by blm.LAST_MODIFIED desc || Step 5: Check that amount columns: Billed Amount (Display Currency) and Outstanding Amount (Display Currency),  have total values at bottom || Step 6: Check that totals follow column if column moved || Step 7: Select a bill. Add all columns to grid view. Check that data displayed in each column matches database | Expected: USE LINK TO VERIFY DATA: http://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Collections#Grid_Detail_2

tab should resize and move with main window || Step 20: Check that all tab and field title display correctly with correct spelling | Expected: 1st letter should be capitalized || Step 21: Check right Title: Test Add Activity

Steps: Step 1: Setup:Payor with a bill last year, this year and next yearA payment/CR last year this year and next yearA credit note | Expected: Done through Appshell ARDone through Appshell Billing || Step 2: Values come from CLM_PAYOR_SUMMARYUpdated by execute CMSP_SYNC_ALL 1Easier to test with a client with a single matter. Title: Test Job CL017 - Payment Plan Installment Amount Not Met
Description:
Delete Action on the Receipt Card should delete the currently opened Receipt.
 
This option is available at 3 places:
1. On the receipt card itself, 
2. Right-click delete action on the report details grid and 
3. Also on the home tab ribbon bar 
 
- All should do the same functionality.
Steps: Step 1: Setup- An outstanding bill with yourself as the collector with a bill date of at least two days ago- Payor for the bill has an active To Do assigned to yourself (added through payor workspace> To Do) || Step 2: Use following link to gain better understanding of rule. Use this info for testinghttp://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Collections#Collections_Rules_to_Ship | Expected: Stored proc used to create job rowsdbo.CLSP_RULE_017 || Step 3: Create a payment plan for the payor with the bill- Collections> Payor Workspace> Payment Plan- Setup New (if there is an existing payment plan)- Fill in required fields- Click New- Double click under Payment Expected by- put yesterdays date- Amount Expected = 100- Click Save Plan | Expected: Payment plan screen opensIf there is no existing payment plan then the entry screen automatically shows instead of the plan management screenBlank row shows in Schedule gridField becomes editable with a date pickerPayment Plan saves in DB (CLM_Payment_Plan), window closes and Payment Plan Management window shows. || Step 4: Pay off a portion of the oustanding bill using Appshell- Accounts Receivable> Cash Receipts> Cash Receipt Entry- Create a new session, add Control Total and Bank and click Add- Receipt Type = C, enter Receipt Amount = 50 and Client for the bill- Click Ok- Click Add under Payment Allocations- Click Find Bill to locate the outstanding bill- Click Allocate then Save and Exit- Close the entry screen and post the session | Expected: Entry created in BLT_Bill_Amt with Tran_Type = 'CR' || Step 5: Start schedule manager, add a new scheduled job- Leave the parameters as default | Expected: MissedPmtPlanAlert - Alert type for created alertsMissedPmtPlanNote - Note to be attached to created alerts || Step 6: Job completes successfully | Expected: Row created in CLM_JobAlert created for today and assigned to you "Payment Plan Behind"Alert in CLM_Activity with Category = 'A' and shows in Collector view in Collections.Alert contains the payment plan name and the date of the payment plan row (yesterday)

Title: Test General Form Behavior Of Collector View While Viewing Other Collector
Steps: Step 1: Use collector field to select a collector not self || Step 2: Ensure that to do list count is accurate | Expected: Should display the number of items in view || Step 3: Change the amount of items in view by filtering view | Expected: To do list count should reflect changes || Step 4: Check that resize function works properly || Step 5: Verify Capitalization and spelling (the first letter of every command word should be capitalized) || Step 6: Parent forms should have a resize minimize and close box || Step 7: Child forms should have a close box and launch in the same relative position as the parent form || Step 8: No smaller option should be set || Step 9: All Date fields should be large enough to view entire date and display in the correct format based on the Regional Settings of the workstation || Step 10: Check that all fields on the form are the correct size (i.e. if the table property length is 8 the field only allows 8 characters/integers) || Step 11: Are hot keys allowed? If so do they function correctly || Step 12: Invalid entries should display as invalid || Step 13: Changes in Regional settings should not adversely affect form. Values and dates should display correctly based on setting || Step 14: Verify you cannot launch two instances of the form simultaneously || Step 15: Verify launch of correct help files using '(i)' in upper right hand corner || Step 16: Verify tool tips are present on all icons || Step 17: Main window should auto resize to accommodate number of listed items | Expected: Scroll bar should appear as needed || Step 18: Check that selected items highlight / change to selected state || Step 19: Check that selected items return to normal state when deselected || Step 20: Check that keyboard navigation is available within view || Step 21: Check that any tabs function as expected and active tab is well defined || Step 22: Check that all activities showing in view have CLM_ACTIVITY.DONE = N AND CATEGORY = T || Step 23: Check that all activities in view with CLM_ACTIVITY.CATEGORY = A show in alert tab not grid || Step 24: Check that any payor with an alert has alert icon attached to activities || Step 25: Check that any activity with CLM_ACTIVITY.IS_ACTIVITY_AUTO = Y has automated icon || Step 26: Check that all items in view have activity date <= date picker date || Step 27: Create a new follow up activity. Change view to match new activity's date | Expected: New activity should not show in grid for collector other than self || Step 28: Change to bill list view | Expected: All saved searches should be available || Step 29: Change back to To Do LIst View | Expected: Collector selection should remain unchanged

Title: Test Job CL019 - CollectionLetter Payor at @Balance and @Days
Steps: Step 1: Setup:- Payor with a bill- The payor needs to have a contact with an email address- The collector on the bill needs to have an email- Need outlook addin installed? | Expected: Bug 205843: Collection Letter Review Workflow - letter PDFs are not being generatedBill needs to have its BLT_BillP and BLT_BillM Col_Empl_Uno set to a user- whoever you want the email to be sent from || Step 2: Use following link to gain better understanding of rule. Use this info for testinghttp://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Collections#Collections_Rules_to_Ship | Expected: Stored proc used to create job rowsdbo.CLSP_RULE_CL019 || Step 3: When payor balance at a certain amount and number of days and last letter is less than a certain number of days | Expected: Collection letter workflow started || Step 4: Using Expert Admin, create a copy of rule (job) to test || Step 5: Start schedule manager, add a new sheduled job | Expected: Days - Days payor is overduePayorARBalance - Minimum payor AR balanceDaysSinceLastLetter - days since last collection sent to payorToDoType - To Do type for workflow task createdHistoryActivity - Activity Type for history activity createdWorkflowName - Name of workflow being launchedMaxNumberOfBillsToAttach - Max number of bills to be attached to email sent. Title: Test Job CL023 - Unapplied Credit Applied when Bills Outstanding
Steps: Step 1: Use following link to gain better understanding of rule. Use this info for testinghttp://ttwiki/wiki/index.php?title=Collections#Collections_Rules_to_Ship | Expected: Stored proc used to create job rowsdbo.CLSP_RULE_CL023 || Step 2: SetupHave a payor with an outstanding bill || Step 3: Cash receipt applied and gone into either Unapplied, OnAcctFees, OnAcctDisb or Retainer | Expected: Alert created || Step 4: Client Credit || Step 5: Using Appshell> Accounts Receivable> Cash Receipt> Cash Receipt EntryCreate a new session with Control Total $100.00 Bank = BOTClick Ok and Add || Step 6: Receipt Type = CReceipt Amount= $100.00Client = Payor of billClick Ok || Step 7: Change the tab under Payment Allocations to Client CR (it looks greyed out but you can still select it)Click AddAmount = $100.00Data Type = Unapplied Cash || Step 8: Using Expert Admin, create a copy of rule (job) to test || Step 9: Start schedule manager, add a new sheduled jobStart Date- Yesterday (as long as it's before the client credit date)Leave the other 2 as default | Expected: StartDate - Date to start tracking credits appliedCreditAvailableAlertType - Alert type for created alertsCreditAvailableNote - Note to be attached to created alerts || Step 10: Run job | Expected: Note - If it's the first time running this job you may need to do 2 client credits separately as it might not pick up the first row correctly.Job should complete successfully, rows added to CLM_JOBSAlert created for the payor Alert assigned to the oustanding bills collectorCLM_Activity- Category= A || Step 11: Matter Credit || Step 12: Do the same as for Client Credit but change the Payment Allocations to Matter CR instead. | Expected: Job should complete successfully, rows added to CLM_JOBSAlert created for the matters payor Alert assigned to the oustanding bills collectorCLM_Activity- Category= ABug 235301: When a client has matters with different payors, Job CL023 will create alerts for all payors if at least one matter for the client has had credit applied- fixed

Click "Setup New"- If there is no payment plan then it will automatically start a new one | Expected: Payment plan dialog shows || Step 3: Check that required fields show as required- Plan Name- Agreement Date- Currency || Step 4: Check that require field count at the top right | Expected: Should be 2 || Step 5: Fill in required fields | Expected: Save button should become active || Step 6: Select Generate schedule | Expected: Payment schedule dialog should open || Step 7: Create a monthly schedule using any combination of available options | Expected: Ok button should become active when amount frequency and start/end date and amount > 0 entered || Step 8: Select OK | Expected: Schedule should be created || Step 9: Double click the date field for a row | Expected: Field should be editable || Step 10: edit the amount field || Step 11: Select new button | Expected: New empty row should appear || Step 12: Add date and amount to new row || Step 13: Select clear all | Expected: Schedule should be cleared || Step 14: Generate a new weekly schedule || Step 15: Save Payment Plan | Expected: Plan should show in payment plan list || Step 16: Partially pay an amount outstanding on a bill for the Payor - do this via Classic in Accounts Receivable > Cash Receipt Entry-Note: This part cannot be automated. | Expected: Outstanding amount will decrease || Step 17: Go back into the Payment Plan detail card and check the Received value.Note: the payment expected date in the Payment Plan should be 1 day after the Classic cash receipt date to see the received value in the grid in Payment plan. Title: Closed
(Sanity Test) Expert Collections - Sanity Test
Steps: Step 1: Open Expert Collections, and check you are on the Collector View || Step 2: From the Jump to Workspace ribbon group, enter the following payor:SI - Client Brow - 102 | Expected: The Payor workspace for SI - Client Brow - 102 is displayed. || Step 3: Add a To Do to the payor via the ribbon bar, with the following information:Type: Follow up with Payor (Follow up)When: 1 weekOutlook Alert: NoneThen close the dialog. | Expected: An alert bar is now displayed with the To Do Activity we've just created for the payor. No alert bar.Note: It will only show the Alert Bar when Activity date is less than today's date in CLM_ACTIVITY SELECT per.EMPLOYEE_NAME[Assigned],ac.* FROM CLM_ACTIVITY acLEFTJOIN HBM_PERSNL per ON ac.COLLECTOR_ASSIGNED_EMPL_UNO =per.EMPL_UNOORDERBY ac.LAST_MODIFIED DESC || Step 4: Close the Payor workspace dialog.On the Collector view, change the date to a week from now and refresh the grid. | Expected: The ToDo Activity is displayed in the main grid for Collector's To Do List, as the reminder was set for a week from now.The steps say to refresh the grid but the item appears in the grid after you've selected the date and if you refresh, it disappears [2024-03-25 - it doesn't seem to be the case anymore] || Step 5: Right click on the To Do and reassign to TTQA2.Close the dialog, then click Refresh from the ribbon bar.Change the Collector field on the header of Collector's To Do List from yourself to TTQA2. | Expected: The Collector's To Do List grid is now empty.On switching to TTQA2, the Collector's To Do List grid is now populated with the To Do Activity we've just reassigned. || Step 6: Open the Payor workspace by using the Jump To Workspace Field again, and selecting SI - Client Brow - 102 | Expected: The Activity History for this payor now has a record that shows the ToDo was reassigned to TTQA2. || Step 7: Close the workspace dialog.Change to the Bill View from the ribbon bar, in the View group.Go to Advanced search and click on Bill Status, then select Active Bill as the Bill status, and click Search. | Expected: All Bills with the Bill Status Active is returned in main grid as the search result. || Step 8: Right click on one of the Bills at the top e.g. 306, and select Change Bill StatusChange the Bill Status to In Collections | Expected: The Bill disappears from the grid. || Step 9: Change the Bill status search criteria to In Collections instead of Active Bill, then search again | Expected: The Bill we changed the status on e.g. 306 is now the only result returned by the search. || Step 10: Cleanup stepChange the Bill Status of the bill you changed the status back to 'Active Bill'

Test Alerts - Ability to right click and send an email regarding an alert
Description:
Alerts pane
 
Often a collector may need to follow up with an attorney or another member of the accounting staff regarding an alert.  It would be beneficial to be able to right click on an alert and  choose send email
 
This would launch an email dialog and set the subject to the Alert Type + Payor Type and the Body of the email should embed the note that is currently in the hover for the alert.
 
User can enter an email address or select from an employee search to use the email address associated with the employee.

Matching data should be highlighted || Step 16: Remove search / find criteria | Expected: All rows should return to grid || Step 17: Use advance search to filter grid by payor || Step 18: Collapse advance search area | Expected: All rows should return to grid || Step 19: Double click or use right click menu to open workspace card from an alert in alerts tab | Expected: Workspace should open || Step 20: Using right click menu dismiss an alert | Expected: Alert should be removed from tab || Step 21: Change the date on date picker to future date | Expected: Only activities for selected date should show || Step 22: Change the date to a date before today | Expected: Activities for selected date and earlier should show || Step 23: Return to todays date || Step 24: Switch to Recent Tab | Expected: Recent transactions should be displayed for selected activity's client/ payor || Step 25: Switch to the Stats tab | Expected: Data should be displayed for selected activity's client / payor

Title: Admin Settings > Collection :  Alert Activity Type
Steps: Step 1: Navigate to Collections /Alert Activity Type || Step 2: Click on the add new icon (+ sign) || Step 3: Update details for new Alerts activity type || Step 4: Select save || Step 5: Verify DB updates @ CLL_ACTIVITY_TYPE | Expected: Should save as category 'A' || Step 6: Make changes to an existing activity type || Step 7: Select save || Step 8: Verify DB updates @ CLL_ACTIVITY_TYPE || Step 9: Select the activity type you created for this test, click delete icon (X) | Expected: Item should be removed from list || Step 10: Verify DB updates @ CLL_ACTIVITY_TYPE || Step 11: 8210 || Step 12: Code (30 limit)Description (4,000 limit)Is ActiveSystemManual/Auto (1 limit)KeepWhenCurrent (Needs spaces) | Expected: Code for the new Activity TypeDescription of the new activity typeWhether the activity type is activeNot editable field- Will default to No since this is not required by the system (not part of one the automated jobs)Whether this activity type will be for a manual activity entry (M) or used by a schedule entry (A) or both (B). - No validation currentlyDefaults to checked || Step 13: Fill in the fields at the top of the grid | Expected: + Button becomes enabled || Step 14: Click the + button | Expected: Row added to bottom of the grid || Step 15: Click Save button | Expected: Row added to  CLL_Activity_TypeSystem defaults to No (Is NULL in the db?) || Step 16: Double click on one of the fields for the new activity type and edit it | Expected: Field accepts changes || Step 17: Click Save | Expected: CLL_Activity_Type row updated || Step 18: Click X at the far end of the new activity type | Expected: Row removed from the grid || Step 19: Click Save | Expected: CLL_Activity_Type row removed

Title: *WIP Test Allow ability to specify bill group as a level to create an activity and allow the levels to be specified to be created as To Dos
Test Weighted Average Payment Days
Steps: Step 2: For each settled bill, the weighted payment amount is the length of time taken to pay it off * the amount of the bill.The weighted average payment date is the all the weighted amounts / all settled bills total | Expected: SQL in CMSP_Summary_Rebuild.case when Sum(BillTotal)>0 then Sum(WPmtAmt)/Sum(BillTotal) else 0 end as WEIGHTED_AVERAGE_PAYMENT_DAYS || Step 3: SetupA payor with at least one bill paid off (i.e. settled)Add a To Do for the payor using the payor workspace || Step 4: Run  CMSP_SYNC_ALL 1 | Expected: select* from CLM_PAYOR_SUMMARY where PAYR_CLIENT_UNO= 100272Weighted_Average_Payment_Days is populated || Step 5: Jump to the date of the payors todo if it is not listed || Step 6: Add/Check the column in Collections> Collector View grid under Weighted Average Payment | Expected: Value populated and showing in the grid

Title: Test Custom Columns in Collections
Steps: Step 1: As of 8031, only PayorClientMatterView (client / matter tab) will accept custom columns. Add column to HBM_MATTER. Same column must be added to Matter domain also if you plan to run workflows (File Opening) that save to HBM_MATTER || Step 2: Create a new column using DBEditor form the Bin directory (see attachment for more details instructions) || Step 3: Using Domain Wizard, add your new column to proper domain for use in Collections || Step 4: On the start screen, select to extend existing entity to add a new column or child table || Step 5: Next, choose the table you added the custom column to || Step 6: Next, choose the custom column and then select the desired domain || Step 7: Finish the process and close Domain Wizard || Step 8: Run Deployment manager on the customization environment, Select apply customizations (make sure all other applications are closed) || Step 9: When operation is complete, start Expert Administration || Step 10: Navigate to Collections > Grids > Selected view || Step 11: Add your custom column to the selected view || Step 12: Restart Collections, navigate to selected view | Expected: Your custom column should show in selected view

Title: Automation - CL_Sanity
Description:
The point of this test case is to have a written record of all the actions covered by a specific automation test. It is never supposed to be run manually. 
 
I should be updated as the associated test is updated.
Steps: Step 1: Black = Steps in automated testRed = Should be in the test but isn't due to a bug or somethingBlue = Steps being done to work around bugs that will hopefully be removedOrange = Enhancements you'd like added to the test || Step 2: Clear the cache || Step 3: Launch Collections as a user with full admin rights || Step 4: From the Collector's To Do List, use the Jump to Workspace shortcut to jump to the Payor SI -Client Brow - 102 || Step 5: In the Payor Workspace, click the To Do button in the ribbon bar || Step 6: In the To Do window, set Type = Follow up with Payor | Expected: Check that there's nothing in the grid || Step 7: Set When = Go To Date > Today || Step 8: Close the To Do window || Step 9: Use SQL to check the newest CLM_ACTIVITY entry has the same EMPL_UNO as the Admin User you're running the test as || Step 10: Close the Payor Workspace window || Step 11: In the Collections main window, set the Date filter to today | Expected: There should be something in the grid || Step 12: Use the context menu to reassign the to do item you've just created || Step 13: In the Reassign window setReassign To = TTQA3Reason = Automated reassign || Step 14: Click the Reassign button in the menu bar || Step 15: Back in the main window, use the refresh button in the ribbon bar | Expected: To Do list should now be empty || Step 16: Use the Collector filter to set the Collector to TTQA3 | Expected: Check that the grid has something in it || Step 17: Use the Jump to Workspace shortcut to jump to the Payor SI -Client Brow - 102 || Step 18: In the Payor Workspace window, check that the grid is not empty || Step 19: Check that the notes of the activity contain the name TTQA3 || Step 20: Close the window || Step 21: Back in the main window, set the view to Bill using the ribbon bar || Step 22: Use the ribbon bar to turn the Advanced Search Bill Status field on || Step 23: Set the Bill Status to Active BillSearch || Step 24: Use the context menu to change the Bill Status of the first bill in the grid || Step 25: Change Bill Status to = In CollectionsClick Change Bill Staus in the ribbon bar || Step 26: Back in the main window, clear the advanced search || Step 27: Search for the Bill Status "In Collections" || Step 28: Check that this returns one row. || Step 29: Close the Collections window

Title: Automation - CL_Smoke_Collector_View
Description:
The point of this test case is to have a written record of all the actions covered by a specific automation test. It is never supposed to be run manually. 
 
I should be updated as the associated test is updated.
Steps: Step 1: Black = Steps in automated testRed = Should be in the test but isn't due to a bug or somethingBlue = Steps being done to work around bugs that will hopefully be removedOrange = Enhancements you'd like added to the test || Step 2: Clear the cache || Step 3: Launch Collections as a user with full admin rights || Step 4: Check that date picker displays todays date as default || Step 5: From the Collector's To Do List, use the Jump to Workspace shortcut to jump to the Payor SI -Client Brow - 102 || Step 6: In the Payor Workspace, click the To Do button in the ribbon bar || Step 7: In the To Do window, set Type = Follow up with Payor | Expected: Check that there's nothing in the grid || Step 8: Set When = Go To Date > TodayClick Add | Expected: Check that there is 1 item in the grid || Step 9: Use SQL to check the newest CLM_ACTIVITY entry has the same EMPL_UNO as the Admin User you're running the test as || Step 10: Set When = Go To Date > TodayClick Add | Expected: Check that there are 2 items in the grid || Step 11: Use SQL to check the newest CLM_ACTIVITY entry has the same EMPL_UNO as the Admin User you're running the test as || Step 12: In the To Do window, set Type = Follow up with Payor | Expected: Check that there's nothing in the grid || Step 13: Set When = Go To Date > TodayClick Add | Expected: Check that there are 3 items in the grid || Step 14: Close the To Do window || Step 15: Close the Payor Workspace window || Step 16: From the Collector's To Do List, use the Jump to Workspace shortcut to jump to the Payor Executive Technologies (50505) || Step 17: In the Payor Workspace, click the To Do button in the ribbon bar || Step 18: In the To Do window, set Type = Follow up with Payor | Expected: Check that there's nothing in the grid || Step 19: Set When = Go To Date > TodayClick Add | Expected: Check that there is 1 item in the grid || Step 20: Use SQL to check the newest CLM_ACTIVITY entry has the same EMPL_UNO as the Admin User you're running the test as || Step 21: Close the To Do window || Step 22: Close the Payor Workspace window || Step 23: Check that there are 3 items is displayed on the grid, and that the date matches the current date || Step 24: Filter the grid using the search/ find box. | Expected: Rows should filter. Matching data should be highlighted || Step 25: Remove search / find criteria | Expected: All rows should return to grid || Step 26: Use advance search to filter grid by payor || Step 27: Collapse advance search area | Expected: All rows should return to grid || Step 28: Using right click menu change the group by setting to To Do | Expected: Check that the grid items are grouped by To Do || Step 29: Using the right click menu add 2 additional column to the grid | Expected: These columns should appear in grid || Step 30: Select an activity Using the right click menu Open a workspace " | Expected: Workspace card for selected client / payor should open || Step 31: Close the workspaces card || Step 32: Using right click menu and ribbon button create a new activity | Expected: New activity dialog should open || Step 33: Using right click menu and ribbon button Reassign an activity to another collector | Expected: Check that the reassigned To Do item no longer appears in the grid || Step 34: Enter the collector from previous step into the 'Collector' field atop the grid | Expected: Activities for entered collector should be displayed || Step 35: Select multiple activities and attempt to open workspace card using ribbon button | Expected: Check that the Open Workspace button on the ribbon bar is disabled || Step 36: Using right click menu and ribbon button initiate Push to new date feature | Expected: Workspace card for selected client / payor should open || Step 37: Double click on an activity row | Expected: Workspace cards for selected client / payor should open || Step 38: Export the contents of the collector view grid to excel using right click menu and ribbon button || Step 39: Open a bill || Step 40: Change the currency from USD to ZMK via the ribbon bar | Expected: Dollar values for display amount columns should change to ZMK || Step 41: Double click or use right click menu to open workspace card from an alert in alerts tab | Expected: Workspace should open || Step 42: Using right click menu dismiss an alert | Expected: Alert should be removed from tab || Step 43: Change the date on date picker to future date | Expected: Only activities for selected date should show || Step 44: Change the date to a date before today | Expected: Activities for selected date and earlier should show || Step 45: Return to todays date || Step 46: Switch to Recent Tab | Expected: Recent transactions should be displayed for selected activity's client/ payor || Step 47: Switch to the Stats tab | Expected: Data should be displayed for selected activity's client / payor

Title: Automation - CL_Smoke_Bill_View
Description:
The point of this test case is to have a written record of all the actions covered by a specific automation test. It is never supposed to be run manually. 
 
I should be updated as the associated test is updated.
Steps: Step 1: Black = Steps in automated testRed = Should be in the test but isn't due to a bug or somethingBlue = Steps being done to work around bugs that will hopefully be removedOrange = Enhancements you'd like added to the test || Step 2: Clear the cache || Step 3: Launch Collections as a user with full admin rights || Step 4: Use advance search to fill the bill view grid || Step 5: Use save button drop down to save the executed search || Step 6: Check links in bill view grid a. Bill Number b. Payor c. Bill Type | Expected: a. Bill number link should open bill if available b. Payor link should open workspace card c. Bill type (split & consolidated ) should open inquiry || Step 7: Use right click menu to group grid by payor || Step 8: Use right click menu to add 2 display currency columns to grid || Step 9: Select a bill. Change bill status using right click and ribbon bar || Step 10: Select a bill. View bill using right click and ribbon bar || Step 11: Explore the different email options | Expected: Each email option should function as expected || Step 12: Export bills list using right click and ribbon button || Step 13: Use the currency ribbon button to change display currency | Expected: Display currency fields amounts should change to selected currency || Step 14: Perform another saved search with different values || Step 15: Save this search using the save button drop down | Expected: Both saved searches should show in saved search menu || Step 16: Using advanced search A/R status, check that search can return bills for each status not just outstanding | Expected: User should have access to all bills, not just outstanding bills

Title: Admin Settings > Collction : setup the Cumulateive Aging Set Value
Steps: Step 1: when first deploy in a new DB , open the Collection will receive an error message of missing Cumulative Aging Set, this is because the value is missing in the Admin Setup || Step 2: Open Admin App || Step 3: Navigate to Collections >Firm Options > || Step 4: Filling the value for the 'Cumulate Aging Set'   default || Step 5: save the change

Steps: Step 1: Set up Security | Expected:  Collections User – standard user permissions for the Collections application Collections Administrator – administrator permissions for the Collections application Collections Manager – manager permissions for the Collections application || Step 2: Configure Firm Settings | Expected:  Activity Types used for Collections activities Collection statuses and risk levels Default parameters Collector and Payment Terms assignment for bills Columns and fields for the grids Utilize standard rules available withCollections || Step 3: Setup workflows | Expected: for more details see attached file

Title: Collestion Setup > Appshell
Collection> Bill View > Grid : Test View Bill
Steps:
Step 1: The bills can be opened from the Grid Hyperlink  or use the ribbon button View Bill || Step 2: Create a new time Entry for a client || Step 3: Open Expert Time , create a new time entry for a client (in this test , you will need to create time entries for two different, one for test bill created in Appshell, the other one for test bill create in Expert billing ) || Step 4: Submit, Release then post the time entry. || Step 5: Create outstanding bill for testing || Step 6: There are two ways to create an outstanding bill : Appshell and Expert Billing. use the following share step in step 7, 8 and 9 to create two bills for testing || Step 7: Two new outstanding bill will be created . Verify the bill is saved properly select * from DDS_DRAFT order by LAST_MODIFIED desc
select * from BLT_BILL order by LAST_MODIFIED desc || Step 8: Test View Bills || Step 9: open Expert Collection and open the bill view || Step 10: search for the  Bill number you just created () | Expected: the bill info will be listed out in the grid || Step 11: In the Bill number column , the bill number will be displayed with the Hyperlink , click the bill number , the attached bill be opened -verify it opened the correct bill document || Step 12: Click the View Bill button on the top ribbon bar, verify it opened the correct bill document

Validation passes. || Step 22: Multiple Valid Emails with Spaces - Enter multiple valid email addresses separated by semicolons with spaces (e.g., valid1@example.com; valid2@example.com) and send reminder email. | Expected: Email sent successfully to all addresses. Spaces trimmed during validation. || Step 23: Trailing Semicolon Handling - Enter valid emails followed by a trailing semicolon (e.g., valid@example.com;) and send reminder email. | Expected: Email sent successfully. Blank entry after semicolon ignored gracefully. || Step 24: ReminderViewModel Email Validation Integration - Verify that IsValidEmailString method is invoked during reminder email creation and handles semicolon-separated addresses. | Expected: Method consolidates validation logic. All emails validated using EmailAddress.IsValidEmail.

Title: Collections- Reminder Statements- View

Check the other tabs | Expected: The value of displayCurrencyId should be changed to the new currency chosen in CollectionsThe other tabs should be in the same display currency as the one you changed to (including payor workspace) || Step 3: Bill View1. Open Collections and in the Bill view change the currency in the ribbon panel to something else.2. Close Collections3. Check Config Manager4. Open Collections5. Check the other tabs | Expected: The value of displayCurrencyId should be changed to the new currency chosen in CollectionsThe other tabs should be in the same display currency as the one you changed to (including payor workspace) || Step 4: Timekeeper View1. Title: Collections- Reminder Smoke Test
Steps:
Step 1: Pre reqs Additional Security - to display buttons Edit in Word and Generate PDF AllowEditReminderStatementInWord Files existButtons enabled/disabled based on the following rules about the files existing Edit in word:- True if both word and pdf exist.- True if only word exists.- False if only pdf exists.- False if both word and pdf does not exist.- False if more than one reminders are selected. View Reminder:- True if both word and pdf exist.- False if only word exists.- True if only pdf exists.- False if both word and pdf does not exist.- True if at least one reminder in the list meets the enable criteria Generate pdf:- False if both word and pdf exist.- True if only word exists.- False if only pdf exists.- False if both word and pdf does not exist.- True if at least one reminder in the list meets the enable criteria. || Step 2: Collections> Reminder tab || Step 3: Create a reminder list1. Click Create on ribbon panel2. Fill out required fields 3. Click Create List | Expected: Reminder list created and shown in the gridThe collector assigned is activeThe assigned collector is correctly linked to an outstanding bill and not to any settled or cancelled billsBug 258832: BUG: Inactive collectors could be used when creating reminder listBug 262560: BUG: Reminder Statements use the Highest EMPL_UNO for the Payors Bills to assign the Collection Employee || Step 4: Edit Reminder1. Select a reminder row and click Edit Reminder2. Change one of the fields3. Click Save | Expected: Bug 195872: Reminder View - Edit reminder form does not alert user that save is completeField is saved and the new value is shown in the grid - Fixed || Step 5: Create Reminder1. Select a reminder row 2. Click Create Reminder> View> In Review | Expected: Creating Reminder Statements loading window showsStatus of row changes to In ReviewGenerated reminder statement pdf is opened in default pdf viewer. (If before 82SP1 then it will be a docx) || Step 6: View Reminder1. Click View Reminder | Expected: Reminder Statement pdf is opened in default pdf viewer. (If before 82SP1 then it will be a docx) || Step 7: Generate PDF || Step 8: Click
  'Export' on Ribbon barto either      a. Send to File      b. View 
    c. Attach to email In       Collector View grid        Bill View grid     Timekeeper View grid     Reminder View grid | Expected: Will export Grid content to Excel file and either     a. It will save it as new Excel file or existing excel file can be overwritten.     b. It will save it as new Excel file or existing file can be overwritten, and     will be opened to view     c. It will save it as new Excel file or existing file can be overwritten, and
  itl will be attached to email depending on the option chosenBug 285956: Collection app is crashing when using Export function in Reminder View(found in 824.1) - bug is removed

Title: Collections- Collector- Multicurrency display of Payor A/R
Steps: Step 1: Note: On the test environment I used client KLJ USD Test Client (23232) (comes with dacpac)Can compare to the values displayed in 8110 | Expected: Bug 200639: Collections - A/R range values can show incorrectly in Collector view grid - fixedBug 164760: BUG: Where a payor has multiple bills over different currencies, the Payor Total AR value may be imbalanced by a 1 cent from the sum of the bills. - fixedselect*from TBL_CURR_RATE where CURRENCY_CODE='CAD'orderby LAST_MODIFIED descMost recent postitive DRUNO that the bills use:RATE= 1.092007784100000RECIPROCAL= 0.915744388053213 || Step 2: Create Time entries with dates that fall within the AR aging buckets (can check in Collections stat panel on the collector view what the aging is).e.g. T-40, T-70, T-100 etc. || Step 3: Post the Time entries || Step 4: Create a prebill for the oldest time entry first (otherwise it will place all your time entries on a recent bill)1. Create Prebills2. Change Bill Date to after the oldest time entry date but before the next time entry. || Step 5: Modify the Fees to Bill = USD$8400.00 | Expected: Total Bill value = $8568.00 || Step 6: Prepare the bill and post it || Step 7: Repeat 4-6 for the other time entries from the oldest to most recent. || Step 8: Run EXEC CMSP_SUMMARY_REBUILD | Expected: Collections summary tables updated:select*from CLM_PAYOR_SUMMARY where PAYR_CLIENT_UNO=15 and CURRENCY_CODE='CAD'Look at the PayorTotalAr, PayorArCurrent and PayorArRanges. These values are in Canadian currency due to the query. || Step 9: Check Collector display values1. Change the display currency to CAD2. Have a To Do for the client you made the bills for3. In the Collector view select the To Do4. Change the left hand panel to the Stats tab5. Right click and add the Payor AR columns | Expected: The correct value is CAD$9356.32 Note: To check the Payor AR Total you can compare with Appshell: Quicklook Inquiries> Client> Client Summary> Bills. Type in the client code and click Select. Look at Total A/R. Remember to change the display currency in Appshell above the nav menu.  Check the values under the AR heading. Check the values displayed in the grid || Step 10: Check Payor Workspace display values1. Open the payor workspace for the client2. Check that the display currency is CAD3. Check the header4. Check the Summary tab | Expected: Note: To check the Payor AR Total you can compare with Appshell: Quicklook Inquiries> Client> Client Summary> Bills. Type in the client code and click Select. Look at Total A/R. Remember to change the display currency in Appshell above the nav menu.  Total Outstanding ARTotal AR in the grid || Step 11: Check Ad hoc Reminder Statement display values 1. Change the display currency to CAD or EUR (different from Payor currency)2. Create Ad hoc reminder statement > go to Payor reminder > Payor/ Matter reminder > Create reminder > select any option  i-e To File, View, Email, Email Preview and Print > select any State i-e Review, Reminder Prepared and Done | Expected: Should create reminder statement in currency selected earlier on the Collector view ribbon bar. Ensure docudraft reminder statement template supports using different currency rather than just system currency (attached template) Bug: 267469 CLSP_CREATE REMINDER_STATEMENTS pulls system currency code while CLSP_CreateReminders pulls payor currency code

Click save | Expected: Inline Add Activity showsMatter field showsAble to find and select the matter Activity saves to the database correctly and is displayed in the Payor Workspace Activity History || Step 7: Create To Do | Expected: Payor Workspace || Step 8: Payor Workspace1. Open the payor workspace for the payor2. Click To Do in the ribbon panel3. Change the To Do level to Matter4. Click the Client/ Matter field and enter the client matter5. Title: Basic Functionalities - Can I use Expert Collections to do basic tasks like creating, reassigning and deleting a To-Do as well as changing the bill status?
Description: Open Expert CollectionsChecking the Collector ViewOpen the payor workspace for SI -Client Brow - 102Create a To DoClose the Payor WorkspaceCheck that the To Do is present in the Collector's To Do ListReassign the To Do to another Lawyer (At this stage the reassigned To Do Activity will disappear)Reassigned To Do activity will appear in the other Lawyer's viewDelete the To DoClose the Payor WorkspaceChange the bill statusPerform an Advanced Search to return bills with the Active Bill statusAssigning the bill to a different statusCheck the changed status for the billChange the Bill Status back to the original statusClose Expert Collections

Title: Test Mission Expert Collections - Can Expert Collections rules be scheduled to automate the creation of Collections activities and alerts
Description:
Expert Collections ships with a set of standard rules that help automate the creation and maintenance of Collections activities and alerts.
Check that these rules can be scheduled and run properly with Schedule Manager

Title: Test Mission Expert Collections - Can admin users setup collector assignments to control who collections activities are assigned to
Description: Collector Assignment can be setup in Expert Administration to control which collectors the automated Collections activities are assigned to. Test that this setting is adhered to when activities are created

Title: Test Mission Expert Collections - Do ribbon bar actions and tools work as intended
Description: Test that ribbon bar actions and tools work as intended when selcted form teh ribbon bar or right click menu

Title: Test Mission Expert Collections – Can users view bills in Expert Collections, can those bills be attached to Collections activities and emails
Description: Test that the view bill method works correctly for bills created using Docu Draft or Expert Image and those bills can attach to Collection activities and Emails generated within Collections

Title: Test Mission Expert Collections – Can users use the Bill view to view accurate billing data and make simple updates to Bills’ collection status and assigned collector
Description: Test the Bill view to ensure functionality and accuracy

Title: Test Mission Expert Collections – Can users use Expert Collections to create reminder list
Description: Test that the Reminder View can be used to create reminder lists that are correctly filtered based on user entered criteria

Title: Test Mission Expert Collections - Can users use the Timekeeper view to view matter and bill data for assigned timekeepers
Description: Test functionality of Timekeeper view

Title: Test Mission Expert Colllections - Can users create Collections activities from Outlook and send emails from within Expert Collections
Description: Test Expert Collections integration with Outlook

Title: Test Mission Expert Collections - Can custom columns be added to Collections without causing errors with views
Description: Steps to Recreate: 1. Create a custom column in DBEditor on HBM_MATTER 2. In DomainWizard, expose this custom column from HBM_MATTER to the PayorClientMatterView 3. Specify a Relationship Name and Target Entity, to complete the Domain Wizard process 4. Open Deployment Manager and Apply Customizations 5. Once complete, when looking at the [CollectionsModel].[GetPayorClientMatterView] stored procedure, there will be a reference to the custom column listed twice, which causes a SQL error. Note: When trying to look at the Clients/Matters tab in the Payor Workspace of Collections, there will be no data returned because of this. 6. Each time an Apply Customizations is performed, there will be two additional references added to the stored procedure, even if the Apply Customizations process fails. Trouble-Shooting Steps: Ran the stored procedure manually in SQL to verify if an error would be returned, which revealed the duplicate column references

Title: Collections- Collector- Default saved search
Steps: Step 1: Note: Introduced default saved search to Collector View in 821 and 8110.EX4002. || Step 2: Open Collections> Collector View || Step 3: Click the cog button at the top left of the To Do grid and choose some filters || Step 4: Click the carrot top button "^" at the top right of the To Do grid | Expected: Advanced search area appears with the filters you selected in the previous step || Step 5: Put some values into the filters and execute a search for to do items - Can add to do items to the grid through the payor workspace (To Do ribbon button) | Expected: To do items are returned, filtered by the fields in the advanced search || Step 6: Click on the Saved Searches field at the top of the grid> Save As | Expected: Save Search As window shows || Step 7: Type a name for your saved search into the field and click Save | Expected: Your search saves and you can find it in the Saved Searches field.When selected it is executed. || Step 8: Click on the Saved Seaches field> Manage Saved Searches. | Expected: Manage Saved Searches window shows || Step 9: Set the saved search you made as the Default User Search.Close and re-open Collections. | Expected: When you navigate to the Collector tab the saved search should execute automatically. || Step 10: Create another saved search as a Firm Search- if this option is not available you will need to give yourself permission to SaveFirmLevelSearch | Expected: Your search saves and you can find it in the Saved Searches field.When selected it is executed. || Step 11: Set the firm level search as the Default Firm SearchRemove the Default User Search | Expected: After re-opening Collections the User Search will be executedAfter re-opening Collections the Firm Search will be executed || Step 12: When creating a new user level search use the Save as default search checkbox | Expected: The new search that you create is set as the Default User Search || Step 13: When creating a new firm level search use the Save as default search | Expected: The new search that you create is set as the Default Firm Search.

Title: Collections- Activity Level Defaulting
Steps: Step 1: The last activity level selected is the default level when you open a new activity card (don't need to save the activity). || Step 2: Check the config value for your user and see what the lastActivityLevel is.If you have not opened Collections before and do not have a user value, it should default to P (found in Firm Options in Administration)Configuration Manager> All Settings> Preference> Applications> ExpertCollections> UserOptions | Expected: P- PayorC- ClientM- MatterB- BillG- Bill Group (Requires AllowBillGroupActivity security permission that turn off by default) || Step 3: First activity card after opening CollectionsOpen Expert Collections> Collector tab> Add Activity | Expected: Activity Level should default to the config value || Step 4: Save a Payor level activity- Open the activity card again from the Collector Tab- Open the activity card in a payor workspace- Click To Do in any payor workspace- Click the Add New Activity inline the payor workspace- Click the activity card button in the advanced search area of the payor workspace bills tab- Change the activity level of an activity card to Payor level and then close the application | Expected: Config value will reliably change only after closing the application so it may not change upon saving an activityDefaults to Payor levelDefaults to Payor levelDefaults to Payor levelDefaults to Payor levelDefaults to Bill level Config value saves lastActivityLevel = "P" || Step 5: Save a Client level activity- Open the activity card again from the Collector Tab- Open the activity card in any payor workspace- Click To Do in the payor workspace- Click the Add New Activity inline the payor workspace- Click the activity card button in the advanced search area of the payor workspace bills tab- Change the activity level of an activity card to Client level and then close the application | Expected: Config value will reliably change only after closing the application so it may not change upon saving an activityDefaults to Client levelDefaults to Client levelDefaults to Client levelDefaults to Client levelDefaults to Bill level Config value saves lastActivityLevel = "C" || Step 6: Save a Matter level activity- Open the activity card again from the Collector Tab- Open the activity card in any payor workspace- Click To Do in the payor workspace- Click the Add New Activity inline the payor workspace- Click the activity card button in the advanced search area of the payor workspace bills tab- Change the activity level of an activity card to Matter level and then close the application | Expected: Config value will reliably change only after closing the application so it may not change upon saving an activityDefaults to Matter levelDefaults to Matter levelDefaults to Matter levelDefaults to Matter levelDefaults to Bill level Config value saves lastActivityLevel = "M" || Step 7: Save a Bill level activity- Open the activity card again from the Collector Tab- Open the activity card in any payor workspace- Click To Do in the payor workspace- Click the Add New Activity inline the payor workspace- Click the activity card button in the advanced search area of the payor workspace bills tab- Change the activity level of an activity card to Bill level and then close the application | Expected: Config value will reliably change only after closing the application so it may not change upon saving an activityDefaults to Bill levelDefaults to Bill levelDefaults to Bill levelDefaults to Bill levelDefaults to Bill level Config value saves lastActivityLevel = "B" || Step 8: Save a Bill Group level activity- Open the activity card again from the Collector Tab- Open the activity card in any payor workspace- Click To Do in the payor workspace- Click the Add New Activity inline the payor  workspace- Click the activity card button in the advanced search area of the payor workspace bills tab- Change the activity level of an activity card to Bill Group level and then close the application | Expected: Config value will reliably change only after closing the application so it may not change upon saving an activityDefaults to Bill Group levelDefaults to Bill Group levelDefaults to Bill Group levelDefaults to Bill Group levelDefaults to Bill Group level -- it is defaulting to Bill Level now. bug or TC error? Config value saves lastActivityLevel = "G" || Step 9: No Bill level security- For your user deny Security Manager> ExpertCollections>Actions> AllowBillLevelActivity, make sure it is on privilege level = 0 too- Open Expert Collections- Click Add Activity and change the Activity Level to Payor- Open a Payor Workspace and go to the Bills Tab- Click the add activity button in the advanced search area | Expected: If the activity level was blank this is because before you removed BillLevelActivity when your config was set to "B" Defaults to Payor level || Step 10: Outlook Addin Defaulting- Ensure that you have the outlook.msi installed- Check the config value- For an email click Add To Expert Collections- Change the activity level of the activity card (e.g. Matter) and close it.- For another email click Add To Expert Collections-Restart Outlook and for an email click Add To Expert Collections | Expected: Resulting Activity Card should default to the config value.Resulting Activity Card defaults to what you changed the activity level to.New Activity card defaults to the config value again.Note: MS Outlook user preferences for the last activity in the Activity card are saved in the configuration file upon closing the Activity card. In contrast, in the Expert Collection app, these preferences are saved upon closing the Expert Collection application.Bug 266033: BUG: Collections Add-in does not update/save the configuration for last activity level used causing it to reset when re-opening Outlook

Title: Collections - Workflows for Upgrade Testing
Steps: Step 1: Setup || Step 2: Advise Timekeeper Workflow- Expert Collections> Payor Workspace> More Actions> Advise Timekeeper- Choose yourself as the timekeeper- Put in a reason for Escalation - Click OK- Do this twice- Open the workflow task in expert assistant and add a workflow note (start a conversation) for both of them- In Workflow Admin click Refresh- Find the workflows you started and set one to Suspended || Step 3: Write- Off Request- Expert Collections> Payor Workspace> More Actions> Write- Off Request- Put in an amount for Proposed Write Off that is less than $1000- Put in a reason for Write-off- Put in a comment- Click Submit Request- Do this twice- Open the workflow task in expert assistant and add a workflow note (start a conversation) for both of them- In Workflow Admin click Refresh- Find the workflows you started and set one to Suspended || Step 4: After Upgrade | Expected: Bug 205312: Collections - 8110 to 8210 upgrade- Collection workflows fault after upgradeBug 205188: Collections- 8035 to 8210- Write-off Request Approval task contains no information after upgrade || Step 5: Advise Timekeeper1. Resume the workflow2. Open Expert Assistant3. Open the Collection Assistance Task4. Check Client Contacted and Comment Entered and Complete the task5. Wait a week for both of the workflows6. If task is assigned to timekeeper than cancel the process (unless there has been a change to the workflow after this point) so that no one else gets emailed. | Expected: Workflow task has information correct. Workflow Notes still availableTask assigned to timekeeper or alert created saying that the escalation is resolved depending on whether the AR balance for the payor > 0 || Step 6: Write-off Request1. Resume the workflow2. Open Expert Assistant as the Matter Billing Partner for the bill you are trying to write off3. Open the workflow4. Reject or accept the write-off and Complete Task5. Task assigned to Writeoff administration (not sure who this is yet). Can end workflow here if there are no changes.6. Repeat for the other workflow | Expected: Bug 233779: CL- 8210 to 8220 Upgrade-After completing the Write-off Request Approval task after upgrade, Assign Write-offs to Accounting has no performers even if the config value is populated with a valid employee.Matter Billing Partner Approval task assigned The workflow task still has information filled in. There are existing workflow notes still

Title: Collections- Performance- Collection Letter Generation
Steps: Step 1: To test the timings of this (before jobs are implemented in Collections) test whether the logging is outputting when the activity is saved.- In Expert Collections start logging (Backstage (click Expert)> Help> Start next to Enable Logging)- Expert Assistant> Actions> System Monitor> (browser opens) History> Choose a Collections Session.- Expand the advanced search area (Magnifying glass with the + in it at the top right)- Application = Collections- Print a collection letter or reminder statement and see if the logs have something to do with an activity saving around the time you printed the document. | Expected: Note: It's a good idea to backup your database before starting this test.Bug 206281: Collections - If the total time it takes to generate Collection Letters exceeds 1 minute Collections crashes - fixed.Bug 206252: Collections- Printing or emailing many documents from Collector View causes database deadlocks and potentially missing activites - fixed.Bug 206236: Collections- Emailing reminder statements from Collector View crashes Collections after around 250-280 emails reach Outlook - fixed.Bug 234863: CL- Collections crashes on performance environment after attempting to email 1000 collection letters - fixed. Start timing from when you click Create Letter or Statement to when the Save Activity call shows up in the log (can use the timestamp) || Step 2: Print 1000 Collection Letters1. Use the attached SQL script to  make 1000 to dos for different clients2. In Expert Collections Collector View find the 1000 to dos created and select them all3. Click Print> Collection Letters4. Choose to print them5. Click Create Letters | Expected: 824 - Loeb, 100 items, 43 seconds to generate, extra 71 seconds to print to null printer || Step 3: Email 1000 Collection Letters- Ensure that you have outlook addin installed1. Create a collections contact with your email2. Use the attached SQL script to assign that collection contact to 1000 clients3. Use the SQL script that is attached to the step above to create 1000 to dos4. Click Print> Collection Letters5. Choose to email them6. Click Create Letters | Expected: 824 - Loeb, 100 items, 87 seconds

Title: Collections- Performance- Print Reminder Statements
Steps: Step 1: To test the timings of this (before jobs are implemented in Collections) test whether the logging is outputting when the activity is saved.- In Expert Collections start logging (Backstage (click Expert)> Help> Start next to Enable Logging)- Expert Assistant> Actions> System Monitor> (browser opens) History> Choose a Collections Session.- Expand the advanced search area (Magnifying glass with the + in it at the top right)- Application = CollectionsPrint a collection letter or reminder statement and see if the logs have something to do with an activity saving around the time you printed the document. | Expected: Note: It's a good idea to backup your database before starting this test.Bug 206252: Collections- Printing or emailing many documents from Collector View causes database deadlocks and potentially missing activites - fixed.Bug 206236: Collections- Emailing reminder statements from Collector View crashes Collections after around 250-280 emails reach Outlook - fixed.Start timing from when you click Create Letter or Statement to when the Save Activity call shows up in the log (can use the timestamp)You can pause your printer and see when the queue equals the number of statements sent. - Devices and Printers> Right click on Printer> Whats Printing?- Printer queue window should come up. Printer> Pause Printing (may need to click open as administrator first). || Step 2: Collector View || Step 3: Print 1000 Reminder Statements1. Use the attached SQL script to  make 1000 to dos for different clients2. In Expert Collections Collector View find the 1000 to dos created and select them all3. Click Print> Reminder Statements4. Choose to print them5. Click Create Statements | Expected: Note: Be aware that when printing the reminder statements from the collector view it proceeds to open all of them as well. 5/11/2018, Performance environment, 8210, dev.vnext.BuildAll_20181104.6 - 9 minutes from clicking Create Statements to receiving  the last 'Saving Collection Activity' in the logs.824 - Loeb, 35 seconds to generate 100 statements, extra 54 seconds to print to null printer (UI unresponsive until the print finishes) || Step 4: Email 1000 Reminder Statements- Ensure that you have outlook addin installed1. Create a collections contact with your email2. Use the attached SQL script to assign that collection contact to 1000 clients3. Use the SQL script that is attached to the step above to create 1000 to dos4. In the collector view select all the todos and click Print> Reminder Statements5. Choose to Email them6. Click Create Statements | Expected: 6/11/2018- Performance environment, 8210, dev.vnext.BuildAll_20181104.6 - about 6 minutes until all the reminder statements were generated-16 minutes and 45 seconds to generate and get 971 emails into the outbox (used sent/receive progress window) and then Collections crashed.824 - Loeb, 37 seconds to generate 100 statements, extra 34 seconds to email || Step 5: Reminder View list || Step 6: Print 3500 Reminder Statements1. Open Expert Collections> Reminder tab2. Click Create and fill out the required fields to make a reminder list3. If you need to use the attached SQL to add more rows to the reminder list until you have 35004. Select all the rows and click Create Reminder> Print>In review | Expected: 6/11/2018- Performance environment, 8210, dev.vnext.BuildAll_20181104.6 - 3500 reminder statements - 40/3500 statements errored as it tried to process the pdf before the word document was generated. Took 10 minutes but didn't go to the printer.8.5 minutes for generation, 46minutes 47 seconds to be sent to the printer (55 minutes, 20 seconds total). Bug 206173: Collections - While printing reminders from reminder view sometimes it tries to process the pdf before the word doc is available - Fixed7/11/2018- Performance environment, 8210, dev.vnext.BuildAll_20181104.6 Pre testing bug fix - 3500 statements without error. 9 min 45 sec generation, 36 minutes to send to the printer (About 45 minutes total)14/11/2018- Performance environment 8210, dev.vnext.BuildAll_20181114.1 after bug fix - 3500 statements without error. 7 min 50 sec generation, 37 minutes and 40 seconds to send to printer (About 45 mins 32 sec total). After about half way, performance on computer drastically worsened. Task bar disappeared and computer was slow. Required computer restart after the documents had finished. || Step 7: Email 1000 Reminder Statements1. Open Expert Collections> Reminder tab2. Click Create and fill out the required fields to make a reminder list3. If you need to use the SQL attached to the step above to add more rows to the reminder list until you have 10004. Select all the rows and click Create Reminder> Email>In review | Expected: Note: You may want to run the attached SQL to assign a collection contact with a specific email to direct them all at a certain person.

Title: Collections- Collector View- Push to New Date
Steps: Step 1: Original shared step || Step 2: Setup:- Have To Do activities in the Collector Grid (setup through a payor workspace> To Do) - PushToNewDate in Security Manager (ExpertCollections> PushToNewDate) | Expected: Each blue heading is the start of a new test || Step 3: Select a To Do activity in the Collectors To Do grid || Step 4: Click Push to New Date | Expected: Push to New Date dialog should showPush to Date is a date selector and required fieldReason is a text field and is required based on the flags in Expert Admin> Collections> Firm Options> Reason Required for Push To New Date. (stored in config manager>Technical>Applications>ExpertCollections>FirmOptions>ReasonRequiredPushDate)Push to New Date button is disabled || Step 5: Check the Current Date | Expected: Field is disabled and shows the current date of the To Do || Step 6: Select a Push to Date and enter a Reason | Expected: Push To New Date button becomes enabled after required fields are filled. || Step 7: Click Push to New Date | Expected: Updates to CLM_ACTIVITY: select* from CLM_ACTIVITY order by LAST_MODIFIED descNew history activity row - Activity_Type = Push to New Date. The note should have the reason that you entered at the end.- Check that the Activity Date is todays date.Original To do modified- Activity_Date changed to the one entered in the dialog.- Done = N still || Step 8: Change the Date of the Collectors view to the date you pushed the To Do. | Expected: Since the date is in the future, only the to dos on that date in the future are shown.Shows the To Do that you pushed || Step 9: Check the Payor Workspace for the To Do by clicking the payor of the to do in the grid. | Expected: In the History Activity tab there should be the history activity created. || Step 10: Select multiple to dos and do the above steps. | Expected: Warning shows at the top of the dialog telling you how many you have selected.All the activities selected should have history activites created for them with the reason and have their activity dates changed. || Step 11: Try with the right click option. | Expected: Activities selected have history activites created for them with reason and have their dates changed. || Step 12: Cancelling during the process1. Title: Collections- Collector View- Reassign To Do

Find another To Do in the Collector View and click Reassign2. Fill in the fields3. Click Cancel | Expected: Reassign dialog shows  No activity rows created and assigned employee not changed. || Step 13: Without ReassignActivity security policy | Expected: Reassign not shown in ribbon panel or right click menu
