Title: Collections- Customization
Steps: Step 1: VMCRT8220WS301:Column: _FINCOLL_TEXTAdd New Activity Smartform Field: Custom TextNote: There is a problem in Design Studio that is not allowing the form to be saved. (JN - 2020/12/10) FIXED, access form from area node point instead of All Form node. | Expected: Testing Required for this environment:Ensure you can save activity through Collector View ribbonCan save activity through Payor Workspace RibbonGeneral checking through view tabs and payor workspace tabs and that everything loads as expected. || Step 2: Before applying the update: | Expected: To find a plain build all release: \\na.aderant.com\scmposting\82SP1 || Step 3: Add columns to the following tables using DBEdit in Appshell folder:8220: CLM_Activity8220: CLM_Expected_ Payment (not supported in 8210 Bug 208666) HBM_MatterHBM_ClientHBM_Persnl From 8220Ex0009 onwards:BLT_BILL | Expected: Document about customzation testing attached to the test case.Grad video for this with more of a walkthrough:https://aderant.sharepoint.com/RD/graduatedevelopment/Shared%20Documents/Forms/AllItems.aspx?id=%2FRD%2Fgraduatedevelopment%2FShared%20Documents%2FTraining%20Material%20and%20Presentations%2FWeek%205%2FA33%20%2D%20How%20To%20Do%20Your%20First%20Customization%2FVideo%2FA33%20How%20to%20do%20your%20first%20customization%2Emp4&parent=%2FRD%2Fgraduatedevelopment%2FShared%20Documents%2FTraining%20Material%20and%20Presentations%2FWeek%205%2FA33%20%2D%20How%20To%20Do%20Your%20First%20Customization%2FVideo Note: CLM_Activity customization not supported in 8110Bug 213373: BUG: Apply Customization fails if there are domain customization on the Collections domain model - fixedBug 130459: Customization - customization will fail when you add custom column to CLM_ACTIVITY - fixedBug 208666: Custom column on CLM_EXPECTED_PAYMENT cannot be added in Domain Wizard- fixed || Step 4: Create a one to one tableCreate a one to many tableNote: When the document says to add a result key and a foreign key you drag the column you made to the key box (shown in the video)(Do we need these steps? This is testing customizations in general and is not specific to Collections Customizations.) || Step 5: Extend the existing entities:CLM_ACTIVITY- CollectionActivity HBM_Matter:- BillPayorView- PayorClientMatterView- MatterHBM_Client:- BillPayorView- Client- Client Summary- PayorClientMatterViewHBM_Persnl:- EmployeeFrom 8220Ex0009 onwards:BLT_BILL-BillPayorMatterView-BillPayorView-TimekeeperBillView || Step 6: Apply customizations through deployment manager || Step 7: Modify Smartforms to input information into the custom columns and tables || Step 8: Open Design StudioExpert Collections> Forms> General> Add New Activity> Add New ActivityClick Add in the ribbon panel> Text boxSelect the new field from CollectionActivityIn the right hand pane under Content change Text to be the custom column createdSave the form || Step 9: Open Design StudioExpert Collections> Forms> General> Inline Add New Activity> Inline Add New ActivityClick Add in the ribbon panel> Text boxSelect the new field from CollectionActivityIn the right hand pane under Content change Text to be the custom column createdSave the form || Step 10: Open Design StudioExpert Collections> Forms> General> Expected Payment Card> Expected Payment CardClick Add in the ribbon panel> Text boxSelect the new field from ExpectedPaymentIn the right hand pane under Content change Text to be the custom column createdSave the form || Step 11: Smoke test- namely see that grids return results and smartforms accept information and put it into the database.Check that the advanced search filters work as expected for standard and customization columns - Bill View- Payor workspace Bill Tab- Payor Workspace Activity History- Timekeeper view- Add Activity button in Payor Workspace ribbon bar- Expected Payments button in Payor Workspace ribbon bar || Step 12: Apply the update || Step 13: Reapply the customizations through deployment manager || Step 14: Smoke test the Collections customizations again.

Title: Collections- Collection Letter Workflow
Steps:
Step 1: Job CL019 kicks this workflow off. With changes in 8210 regarding how collection letters are generated, this needs to be kept in mind for future fixes as we don't usually remember this. | Expected: Requires you to be the collector of one of the bills so the collection letter task gets sent to you (if there is no collector then it will not be created)Payor also requires a contact ID with email.Bug 241927: CL- Collection Letter Workflow failing to GetDocudraftLetterTemplate because it defaults to template with row_uno = 1 even when no such row exists. || Step 2: Setup- A payor for with an outstanding bill you are the collector for- Payor has a contact with an email- Collection letter has not been sent for the payor for at least a dayHave the Collection Letter workflow imported from the template.- Outlook Addin installed | Expected: Can check BLT_BillP and BLT_BillM -Col_Empl_Uno or use SQL to fulfill this || Step 3: Schedule the jobOpen Schedule ManagerAdd> CL019Days=0DaysSinceLastLetter=0EmbedLetterInEmail= TrueLeave the rest as default || Step 4: Trigger the job/wait for it to executeCheck CLM_JobCheck WFM_Workflow_Summary or Workflow Admin | Expected: Depending on how your database is setup you can get a myriad of error messages in event viewer due to Collections not being able to find a collector (cause 0 is assigned to the bill) or the payor does not have an assigned contactCheck that at least one of the job rows created has Collector_Empl_Uno != 0, Int_1 != 0 (i.e. it has a contact uno)The table shows a summary of the workflows- Check that at least one is Active Check in the DDOutput folder that the collection letter was generated Bug 205843: Collection Letter Review Workflow - letter PDFs are not being generated - fixed || Step 5: Open Expert AssistantInbox>Change the top box to My Tasks | Expected: Collection Letter Review Workflow task should show.Note: Because of bad data, it creates duplicate tasks for a Collector handling the same Payor. (tested in 8240, 8220.EX11.5) Run the below SQL to check if there is a bad data:select * from FWM_EXTENSION_POINT where path like '%CL019%'
select * from FWM_EXTENSION_POINT_RULE where EXTENSION_POINT_UNO = 56
select * from FWM_RULE where RULE_UNO in ('83','556') || Step 6: Open the Collection Letter Review workflow task | Expected: Task window opensBug 273427 - Collection: Collection Letter Review Workflow incompleteApproval bar across the top. Has payor summary with how many bills over the threshold (0 in this case) and how many days it's been since a collection letter was sent. Has options to Send Email or Cancel Sending LetterEmail like format in the main area.To is defaulted from the Payors contact email addressFrom is defaulted from the Collectors email addressCC, BCC, Subject are emptyAttachments: If in CLM_Job TXT_2 is Y, then the bills are attached, otherwise this box is emptyText box with lots of text editing options- this is what the main body of the email will be. || Step 7: Enter a subject and body textEnsure the email address are accurate/ who you want to send the letter to- it can be yourself, to yourself.Click Send EmailClick Complete Task | Expected: Window closes || Step 8: Check that the email sentBills are attached to the email if they were in the taskCheck for errors in Event Viewer | Expected: Bug 205849: Collection Letter Review Workflow - letter attachments from local disk will never attachSince EmbedLetterInEmail= True, the main body of the email is your text plus the collection letter || Step 9: Go through this again with EmbedLetterInEmail = False | Expected: Email should send with the body text in the body of the email and the collection letter attached to the email along with the bills instead.

Title: Test Job CL002M - Matter is now current
Steps: Step 1: SetupA matter you are the collector for that has - No outstanding bills- A matter todo you are assigned to and not done (Done = 'N' and matter_uno populated)- An incomplete alert assigned to you and the matter (has a matter uno in CLM_Activity)- A payor to do (no matter uno) that is not done | Expected: Check you are the collector through Entity Manager> Time and Billing> what the Bill Group is (TBM_BILLGRP. Col_Empl_Uno)This is best tested in conjunction with CL001M as it will provide an alert for the matter and you can settle the new outstanding bill.Can create todos from Payor Workspace> To Do. Change the type to Matter at the top right. || Step 2: This is a matter version of job CL002 | Expected: Stored proc used to create job rowsdbo.CLSP_RULE_CL002M || Step 3: Matter that no longer has a bill that is over Collection Call Days or X days | Expected: Completes To dos for collectors that relate to the matterCompletes Alerts for collectors that relate to the the matterCreates History Activity to inform affected Collectors that todos and alerts are dismissed. || Step 4: Using Expert Admin, create a copy of rule (job) to test || Step 5: Start schedule manager, add a new scheduled jobDays over = 0Leave the rest of the parameters as default | Expected: Schedule Parameter - Days Over (X Days)HistoryActivityforCurrent - Activity type for created history activitiesHistoryActivityNote - Note to be attached to created history activities || Step 6: Run job | Expected: Job should complete successfully, rows added to CLM_JOBSActivities that relate to the matters in CLM_Activity have their Done = Y - Payor level activities should not be affected.History Activity created for the matter.

Title: Test Job CL007M - Matter partial bill payment alert
Steps: Step 1: SetupA matter you are the collector for that has an outstanding bill | Expected: Check you are the collector through Entity Manager> Time and Billing> what the Bill Group is (TBM_BILLGRP. Col_Empl_Uno) || Step 2: This is a matter version of job CL007 | Expected: Stored proc used to create job rowsdbo.CLSP_RULE_CL007M || Step 3: Partially pay the bill through Appshell- Accounts Receivable> Cash Receipts> Cash Receipt Entry- Create a new session, add Control Total and Bank and click Add- Receipt Type = C, enter Receipt Amount and Client- Click Ok- Click Add under Payment Allocations- Click Find Bills- Click Allocate then Save and Exit- Close the entry screen and post the session || Step 4: Using Expert Admin, create a copy of rule (job) to test || Step 5: Start schedule manager, add a new scheduled jobStart Date = YesterdayLeave other parameters as default | Expected: StartDate- Date to start tracking partial paymentsPartialPaymentAlertType - Alert type to be createdPartialPaymentalertNote - Note to be attached to created alerts || Step 6: Run job | Expected: Job should complete successfully, rows added to CLM_JOBSAlert saved to CLM_Activity with category ='A', the correct Payor and Matter_Uno and assigned to you. Alert shows in Collector view.

Title: Test Job CL015M - Matter skipped payment
Steps: Step 1: SetupA matter you are the collector for that has at least 2 outstanding bills | Expected: Check you are the collector through Entity Manager> Time and Billing> what the Bill Group is (TBM_BILLGRP. Col_Empl_Uno) || Step 2: This is a matter version of job CL0015 | Expected: Stored proc used to create job rowsdbo.CLSP_RULE_CL015M || Step 3: Using Appshell, pay off the second bill/bill with a higher bill number - Accounts Receivable> Cash Receipts> Cash Receipt Entry- Create a new session, add Control Total = outstanding bill amount and Bank and click Add- Receipt Type = C, enter Receipt Amount = outstatnding bill amount and Client- Click Ok- Click Add under Payment Allocations- Click Find Bills- Untag the first bill (double click the checkmark)- Click Allocate, ensure that the red total=$0.00 then Save and Exit- Close the entry screen and post the session || Step 4: When a payment is skipped | Expected: Create an alert for the collector on the billUses SOURCE_TRAN_UNO, PAYOR_UNO and COLLECTOR_ASSIGNED_EMPL_UNO to determine whether the alert has been created already. || Step 5: Using Expert Admin, create a copy of rule (job) to test || Step 6: Start schedule manager, add a new scheduled job- Leave parameters as default | Expected: SkipPaymentAlertType - Alert type for created alertsStartDate - First bill date to start trackingSkippedPaymentNote - Note to be attached to created alerts || Step 7: Run job | Expected: Job should complete successfully, rows added to CLM_JOBSAlert saved to CLM_Activity with Category = 'A', correct payor and matter uno and assigned to you.Alert shows in Collector view 'Skip Payment' and states the other outstanding bills that are earlier than the bill you paid off.

Title: Collections - Customization - Write-off request- Change Finance Director Approval threshold
Steps: Step 1: Im you ExpertShare>Workflows>TemplatesUnzip the Workflow Collections Template | Expected: Assign a Finance Director through Config Manager> Technical>Applications>ExpertCollections>WorkflowGroups>Finance Directors. || Step 2: Open the Workflow.Collections.Template.sln in Admin VS || Step 3: In the Solution Explorer navigate to Aderant.Workflow.Collections.WriteOffRequest> Activities> WriteOffApprovalHelper.cs || Step 4: Two functions:GetWriteOffRequestsForFinanceDirectorGetApprovedWriteOffRequestsUnderThreshold | Expected: Both have 1000 hardcoded as the threshold || Step 5: Change the hardcoded 1000 to 5000 || Step 6: Save the solution, build the solution, and Run the workflow once | Expected: Bug 254502, will need to run the workflow before exporting the package https://tfs.aderant.com/tfs/ADERANT/ExpertSuite/_workitems?id=254502&_a=edit || Step 7: Create a new package in DS for the workflow || Step 8: Import the new workflow package you just created || Step 9: Collections> Payor Workspace> More Actions> Write-off Request || Step 10: For a bill under Proposed Write-off put in $4999Fill in the required fields (Reason for Write-off)Submit Request || Step 11: Start another write-off request at $5000

Title: Collections-Workflow-WO Request- Rejection
Steps: Step 1: Setup:Finance Director setup- Employee Uno expectedAccountingGroup setupWorkflow package importedA payor with at least 3 bills (1 over $1,000) | Expected: Bug 226096: Write off Workflow Request is not working- fixed 83.Config Manager> Technical>Applications>ExpertCollections>WorkflowGroups>FinanceDirectors. Note- currently an issue where the workflow solution is pointing to the wrong config area in WriteOffApprovalHelperConfig Manager> Technical>Applications>ExpertCollections>WorkflowGroups>AccountingGroup. Note- currently an issue where the workflow solution is pointing to the wrong config area in WriteOffApprovalHelper || Step 2: Open Expert Collections>Payor Workspace> More Actions> Write-off Request || Step 3: Propose a write-off value for each bill- Two that total to less than $1000 (e.g $250)- One that totals to more than $1000 (e.g $1250) | Expected: Note: You need to fill in all the propsed write off fields with a number, even if that number is 0 or it will sum it as 0 (fixed at 8300)Reason Field becomes required || Step 4: Fill in the Reason Field and hit Submit | Expected: One task created with all three bills on it || Step 5: Find the approval task | Expected: May need to reassign it through Workflow AdminEach bill has it's WO proposals that you entered still assigned to the right bill. || Step 6: Choose Individual Approve/Reject at the top | Expected: Comment box and Write-Off Approved fields show and are enabled and required. || Step 7: Type in a comment | Expected: It will be the same across all of the proposals || Step 8: Approve the WO over $1000 and one of the WOs less than $1000 || Step 9: Reject one of the WO under $1000 || Step 10: Complete the task | Expected: Two alerts created for the payor:- Write-off Denied "Write off request rejected. Reason [comment entered]., [Bill number] (Bill Total: [Bill total], Write-Off [WO value] ([user who rejected it])"- Write-off Approved (the other bill less than $1000 that was approved) "Write off approved and has been sent to Accounting Dept for processing. [Bill number] (Bill Total: [Bill total], Write-Off [WO value] ([user who approved it])]"Two tasks are created- Assign Write-offs to Accounting- Assigned to the correct user from config manager- Finance Director Approval- Assigned to the correct user from config manager || Step 11: Finance Director Approval-Reject All Enter a commentComplete Task | Expected: For the bill with the WO over $1000Comment box shows as empty and requiredWrite-off Denied alert- Write off request rejected.  Reason: [comment entered]., [Bill number] (Bill Total: [Bill total], Write-Off [WO value] ([user who rejected it])Email to matter billing partner?These might occur after the last task for the workflow is complete (i.e. the assign write-offs to accounting). || Step 12: Assign Write-offs to AccountingDeclineEnter a commentComplete Task | Expected: For one of the bill with the WO less than $1000Comment box shows as empty (not required?)Email to Matter billing partner? I don't think we keep track of what happens here.

Title: Collections- Outlook Addin Per Machine MSI install validation
Description: There are several other checks we need to make to ensure all the MSI installed as expected other than installation running to completion.Recommended to use ExpertAssistantPerMachine.msi
Steps: Step 1: Install ExpertOutlookAddInMsiPerMachine.msi from the ExpertShare | Expected: Installation completes successfully. Standard windows installation. Window will close and will not open Outlook or anything. || Step 2: Check application short cut is installed into the right location | Expected: Go to "C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Aderant" and make sure there is a short cut for Aderant Expert Outlook Addin || Step 3: Right click the shortcut> Properties | Expected: Target should point to the Aderant.Expert.Outlook.AddInCO.exe || Step 4: Check the registry entry is presentGo to the registry hive (regedit in start menu).Depending on what bit your outlook is:64 Bit: 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/SOFTWARE/Aderant' 32 Bit: 'HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/SOFTWARE/WOW6432Node/Aderant' | Expected: Should be an Aderant.Expert.Outlook.AddIn entry || Step 5: Check registry values are correct | Expected: Go to the node in the previous step.CLEAN should be set to 1EXPERTENVIRONMENTNAME should match environment nameinstalled should be set to 1 || Step 6: Restart Outlook | Expected: Addin present in the ribbon of Outlooks Home tab. "Add To Expert" || Step 7: Log on (or remote desktop) onto machine as another user.Open Outlook. | Expected: Addin present in the ribbon of Outlooks Home tab. "Add To Expert" || Step 8: Cannot install per user version of the msi | Expected: Error that a version of the msi is already installed

Title: CL- Reminder View- Reminder List Creation- Cut off Dates
Steps: Step 1: General notes:Bill Date needs to be before the cutoff datePayment Date needs to be after the cutoff date | Expected: If a payment was made before this date, then they have already done their payment for this run of reminder statements so no need to remind them again. || Step 2: Setup:Client matter with just 1 billA payment made for that bill through AR | Expected: Know the Bill Date (BLT_Bill. Bill_Date)CR transaction date (BLT_Bill_Amt.Tran_date) || Step 3: Collections> Reminder View> Create Reminder ListPayor level listCommon Criteria:List code and List NameReminder DateTkpr Type on ReminderDays at least one Bill overMinimum A/R (USD)Rest as default (checkboxes not checked)Additional CriteriaPayor Client | Expected: Any stringTodayAny option01Payor of the bill setup || Step 4: Same DayPayment Cutoff Date= Date of CR transactionBill Cutoff Date = Bill date | Expected: Payor row present in reminder list || Step 5: Payment after cutoff, Bill after cuttoffPayment Cutoff Date= Date of CR -1Bill Cutoff Date = Bill Date -1 | Expected: Payor row not present in reminder list- Bill cutoff date criteria not fulfilled. || Step 6: Payment before cutoff, Bill before cuttoffPayment Cutoff Date= Date of CR +1Bill Cutoff Date = Bill Date +1 | Expected: Payor row not present in reminder list- Payment cutoff date criteria not fulfilled. || Step 7: Payment after cutoff, Bill before cuttoffPayment Cutoff Date= Date of CR -1Bill Cutoff Date = Bill Date +1 | Expected: Payor row present in reminder list- Both criteria fulfilled || Step 8: Payment before cutoff, Bill after cuttoffPayment Cutoff Date= Date of CR +1Bill Cutoff Date = Bill Date -1 | Expected: Payor row not present in reminder listBoth of the criteria are not fulfilled

Title: CL- Collections workflow upgrade test
Steps: Step 1: Setup:Workflows importedAn update behind where you need to test | Expected: Managenent Escalation does not need to be tested here as no tasks are created for it (after it submits, it creates and activity and completes) || Step 2: Collection Letter (CL019) WF Setup- A payor for with an outstanding bill you are the collector for- Payor has a contact with an email- Collection letter has not been sent for the payor for at least a day- Collection letter template setup- Outlook Addin installed || Step 3: Exception Status setup- Payor with overdue bills (e.g. Arden Industries)- Be the COL_EMPL_UNO on the bills-No active To Dos for payor (PW>To Do> Remove items from grid)- Payor has exception status (PW> Change Status> Change Status) || Step 4: Write-off WF SetupConfig manager> Technical> Applications> ExpertCollections> WorkflowGroups- Finance Director setup- Employee Uno expected- AccountingGroup setup- Employee Uno expected- A payor with at least 2 bills (1 over $1,000) || Step 5: Start the workflows || Step 6: Run CL019Open Schedule ManagerAdd> CL019Days=0DaysSinceLastLetter=0EmbedLetterInEmail= TrueLeave the rest as default | Expected: Job kicked off and runsCollection Letter Review WF task created || Step 7: Run Exception Status WF (CL032)Open Schedule ManagerAdd> CL032Daysover=0Leave the rest as default | Expected: Job kicked off and runsException status WF task created || Step 8: Advise TimekeeperCollections> Payor Workspace> More Actions> Advise TimekeeperPut yourself as the TimekeeperEnter reason for escalationClick Ok | Expected: Advise Timekeeper task created || Step 9: Write-off RequestCollections> Payor Workspace> More Actions> Write-off RequestPropse a write-off value for two bills- One that totals to less than $1000 (e.g $250)- One that totals to more than $1000 (e.g $1250)Fill in reason field for both and hit submit | Expected: Write-off request task created for Matter billing partner || Step 10: Suspend all the workflow tasksFind the workflow rows in WorkflowAdminRight click> Suspend | Expected: Workflows go into suspended state. || Step 11: Upgrade to next update || Step 12: Resume the WFsChange Processes to Suspended Processes in WorkflowAdminFind the workflow rows Right click> Resume || Step 13: Check that the tasks can be opened and the workflows completed

Steps: Step 1: An easier setup if you are not sure what you doing. Don't recommend doing this on ITE as it changes admin settings.In Admin, Collections Firm Options, set Default Collector = you.Payment Terms = NET90 - (HBL_PAYTERM.PAYTERMS_DAYS = 90 , COLLECT_CALL_DAYS = 91)Collector Assignment = Firm Collector.Payment Term Assignment = Firm Payment Term. | Expected: DECLARE @date DateTime  = '2021-07-16' --today's dateSELECT bba22.payr_client_uno as Payor, Datediff(day, blb.BILL_DATE, @date) as Daycount, CASE WHEN BLB.BILL_TYPE = 'C' THEN BM.COL_EMPL_UNO ELSE BP.COL_EMPL_UNO END as Empl,bba22.bill_tran_uno as BillTranUnoFROM BLT_BILL_AMT BBA22inner join BLT_BILL blb on blb.tran_uno=BBA22.BILL_TRAN_UNOinner join BLT_BILLM BM on BM.BILL_TRAN_UNO = BBA22.BILL_TRAN_UNO AND BM.MATTER_UNO = BBA22.MATTER_UNOinner join BLT_BILLP BP on BP.BILL_TRAN_UNO = BBA22.BILL_TRAN_UNO AND BP.PAYR_CLIENT_UNO = BBA22.PAYR_CLIENT_UNOinner join HBM_CLIENT C on C.CLIENT_UNO=BP.PAYR_CLIENT_UNOinner join TBM_CLIENT CT on C.CLIENT_UNO = CT.CLIENT_UNOleft join HBL_PAYTERM PT on BP.PAYTERM_CODE=PT.PAYTERM_CODEWHERE(Datediff(day, blb.BILL_DATE, @date) >= CASE ISNULL(PT.COLLECT_CALL_DAYS,-1) WHEN -1 THEN 90 ELSE PT.COLLECT_CALL_DAYS END ) ANDBBA22.TRAN_TYPE = 'BL' AND((BLB.BILL_TYPE='C' AND BM.AR_STATUS='O') OR (BLB.BILL_TYPE IN ('S','M') AND BP.AR_STATUS='O'))AND(CT.COLL_STATUS_CODE is NULL or CT.COLL_STATUS_CODE = '')AND(not exists (select 1from CLM_ACTIVITY Awhere A.PAYOR_UNO = BP.PAYR_CLIENT_UNOand A.COLLECTOR_ASSIGNED_EMPL_UNO = case BLB.BILL_TYPE when 'C' then BM.COL_EMPL_UNO else BP.COL_EMPL_UNO endand A.DONE = 'N'and A.CATEGORY = 'T'))and blb.TRAN_UNO = 25176 --your posted bill || Step 2: Create a new client with Open Date = backdated 95 days.Test with new client to avoid existing ToDo. | Expected: Use google if you unsure the backdated date || Step 3: Create a new matter with Open Date = backdated 95 daysSetup that will be override by Firm setting but I had it anyway:Matter > Time and Billing > AR tab, Payment Terms = NET90.Collector = you || Step 4: Make sure MIN parms date for Billing, Disbursements/Time parms date allow the backdated date. || Step 5: Restart apps so that it picks up new admin/parms setting || Step 6: Create a bill with Bill Date = backdated 91 days. Post bill. grab bill tran uno for SQL purpose if needed || Step 7: Run CLSP_UPDATE_COLLECTOR_ASSIGNMENTS to populate collector in BLT_BILLP || Step 8: Run CLSP_UPDATE_PAYMENTTERM_ASSIGNMENTS to populate payment term in BLT_BILLP || Step 9: Run CL0001 through Design Studio.Not sure why it doesn't run in Schedule Manager. || Step 10: Refresh Collector ToDo list. | Expected: After 254452: A ToDo is created for bill payor and should return to grid when Refresh.Before 254452: No ToDo created for bill payor. || Step 11: Create a bill with Bill Date = backdated 90 days. Post it and repeat Step 7-10. | Expected: After 254452: NO ToDo created for bill payor. || Step 12: Delete all ToDo and do the same test for CL001M

Title: Modern Auth Collections : sanity check list
Steps: Step 1: Note: clear cache is no longer used as it was just used due to the logout not always working. What it does is to remove the token folder from c:\Users\<user>\AppData\Local\Aderant\Identity\ Note: login now should just ask you to select the account you want to use but not ask for a password as it will use your network login Note: first time user will have a number sent to their phone (how do we clean up to test that first time user works? no-one seems to know, so at this point, we'll leave that as part of the infra testing) || Step 2: Pre ex0011 (or might have been an earlier release) Login/Logout1. Clear cache2. Login3. Logout4. Login | Expected: Step 2- Prompted for authentication- Logged into app Step 4- Not prompted for authentication- Logged into app || Step 3: Login/Logout 1. Title: Test Customize button in Add Activity
Steps: Step 1: Go to Expert Collection app || Step 2: Select from option in the help dropdown which will enable the customization mode feature || Step 3: Select "Add Activity" in Collector View or in Jump to Workspace | Expected: When in customization mode, all form embedded in applications will get a border around them and provide a "customize" button || Step 4: Pressing the "Customize" button will show the form information dialog which allows editing of the form if you have rights to design studio. || Step 5: Click "Edit" button next to Add New Activity in Associated Form(s) to launch Design Studio preloaded with the form to customize

Title: Collections - Last Bill Activity Upgrade Testing
Steps: Step 1: Pre-requisite: Set up dataset for 3 types of bills i-e Simple, Consolidated & Split bill with and without History activity created at each activity level i-e Payor level activity, Client level activity, Matter level activity, Bill level activity & Bill group level activity with some ToDo activities. || Step 2: Before upgrade || Step 3: BLT_Bill - Activity level item > Bill Level | Expected: Last Activity Uno Field (COLL_LAST_ACTIVITY_UNO) is updated in BLT_Bill table as History Bill Activity items are captured || Step 4: After upgrade || Step 5: Run deployment and dbgen | Expected: This should migrate & populate existing data to new column,COLL_LAST_ACTIVITY_UNO into tables BLT_BillM and BLT_BillP from table BLT_Bill || Step 6: SQL to run to check if Coll_Last_Activity_Uno column in table BLT_BillM & BLT_BillP has been updated from table BLT_Bill | Expected: Select Coll_Last_Activity_Uno billp,* from BLT_BILLPSelect Coll_Last_Activity_Uno billm,* from BLT_BILLM || Step 7: Functional testing || Step 8: Update/ Delete existing or Create new History activity at Bill level | Expected: It should save comment into COLL_LAST_ACTIVITY_UNO in tables BLT_BillM & BLT_BillP depending on type of Bill

Title: Performance - Reminder Statements
Steps: Step 1: Notes: Checking for the reminder statement files is done in several places but we can test from the just open of the reminder list as its the same code Note: Example data for imports attached || Step 2: Pre req set up SpeedRun fiddler and set to modem speed Docudraft foldersDDOUTPUT with 20,000 filesDDOUTPUT with 1 fileDDPDFs with 20,000 filesDDPDFs with 1 file || Step 3: Pre req data Client/Matters- 2000 (can use generic import)- something unique to be able to filter on such as a billing employee that has not been used for other clients  Posted bills- 2000: 1 for each Client (payor) (could import disbs via disbs app for each client/matter as you'll need some values for the bills) Reminder list 1- Empty list Reminder list 2- Contains a record for each of the bills (2000) || Step 4: Empty List and 1 file in the DD folders | Expected: Local Environment - Modem speed set in fiddler Open list10 secs - using version 822 EX00114 secs - using version 824 PR4 secs - using version 824 Master 30/8/2023instant - 824 RC || Step 5: 2000 in list and 1 file in the DD folders | Expected: Local Environment - Modem speed set in fiddler Open list42 secs - using version 822 EX001154 secs - using version 824 PR54 secs - using version 824 Master 30/8/2023 90 secs - 824 RC (no modem speed - did not load with modem speed) || Step 6: Empty List and 20,000 files in the DD folders | Expected: Local Environment - Modem speed set in fiddler Open list3 mins 26 secs - using version 822 EX00115 secs - using version 824 PR6 secs - using version 824 Master 30/8/2023 instant - 824 RC || Step 7: 2000 in list and 20,000 files in the DD folders | Expected: Local Environment - Modem speed set in fiddler Open list3 mins 23 secs - using version 822 EX001156 secs - using version 824 PR54 secs - using version 824 Master 30/8/2023 90 secs - 824 RC (no modem speed - did not load with modem speed)

Title: Verify Payor Workspace card loading with high volume of Payor history activities

Steps:
Step 1: Preconditions:
  Expert Collections system is accessible.A payor exists in the system.200,000 Activities are created for the payor (refer to 'Summary' tab for activity creation) || Step 2: Open Expert Collection applicationClick on Jump to WS > Payor > Select the Payor(Attempt to load the Payor workspace for the payor.) | Expected: The application should handle the high volume of Activities without causing the
Query service to spike memory usage.
The Payor workspace card should load successfully without shutting down any
services.
Data should be displayed correctly, or the application should provide a meaningful error message if unable to load. || Step 3: Filter by Specific date or Matter | Expected: This should filter the data and allow correct data to load based on the filter selection. || Step 4: 1. Ensure the history activity tab is not the first tab. 2. Verify that the saved search is working well.3.  Check if alerts are loaded automatically, provided Payor has some Alerts exists. | Expected: 1. When you access 'History activity' tab, it should load the history activities based on the default search.2. Saved searches should work as expected.3. All existing Alerts are displayed promptly and accurately. || Step 5: Additional Information:Monitor memory usage on the app server during the test.
